Summary Ik ben ondernemer en mede-eigenaar van Master of Code Nederland. Mijn energie en voldoening haal ik uit het prijsbewust ontwikkelen en leveren van maatwerk IT solutions die zijn toegespitst op het realiseren van de bedrijfsdoelstellingen van mijn klanten. Hierbij start ik een project vanuit het gewenste eindresultaat en toets altijd of dit aansluit aan de beoogde bedrijfsdoelstelling van de klant. Pas als dat duidelijk is ga ik samen met mijn organisatie echt voor u aan de slag. 
 
Onderscheidend in onze aanpak is de keuze om specifieke kennis op één plek te beleggen. Ons internationale ontwikkelcentrum concentreert zich op architectuur, bouw en beheer van softwareoplossingen. Ons lokale leveringsmanagement en onze marktkennis helpen u direct en ontzorgen u gedurende de realisatie en het beheer. Master of Code creëert hiermee een dusdanige balans zodat u profiteert van optimale verhouding van kosten en gewenst resultaat. 
 
In het geval uw bedrijf in de fase verkeert waarbij de bedrijfsdoelstellingen, het bedrijfsmodel of de bedrijfspropositie aan verandering toe is denk ik graag met u mee. Met mijn achtergrond en netwerk kan ik u helpen bij het formuleren van de noodzakelijke aanpassingen en de vertaling daarvan naar een concrete realisatie. Experience Co Owner & Delivery/Sales Director Master Of Code Netherlands October 2014  – Present (11 months) Nederland Voor bedrijven is het vaak de vraag wat ze kunnen verwachten van een softwareontwikkelaar. Kan een ontwikkelaar bijvoorbeeld meedenken over en anticiperen op de marktontwikkeling van het mobiel ontsluiten van informatie? Verder leert de ervaring ons dat de afstemming van bedrijfsdoelstellingen en de vertaling daarvan naar een IT oplossing kostbaar en tijdrovend kan zijn. Onze overtuiging is dat wij het liever in één keer goed doen in plaats van achteraf nog eens de uitgangspunten te herdefiniëren. 
 
Master of Code Nederland geeft helder, platformonafhankelijk advies en ontwerpt, bouwt en beheert aan de hand hiervan doeltreffende softwareoplossingen. Oplossingen op basis van internet en mobiele technologie ten behoeve van interactie met uw klanten, medewerkers, partners door ontsluiting van uw dienstverlening (backoffice). 
 
Het streven is om samen met u de beoogde bedrijfsdoelstellingen te behalen. Deze doelstellingen worden gekoppeld aan de juiste strategische richting én inrichting van de hele digitale keten. Master of Code houdt tussentijds toezicht en draagt de verantwoordelijkheid voor de volledigheid en betrouwbaarheid van de geboden softwareoplossing. 
 
Master of Code Nederland maakt deel uit van een internationaal netwerk gevestigd in de US, Canada, de Ukraine en Nederland. Het netwerk bestaat uit een team van 100+ professionals en wordt vertegenwoordigd door applicatie architecten, software ontwikkelaars, project managers, business consultants en analysten, quality assurance en database specialisten. 
 
www.masterofcode.nl Director Benelux for Application Consulting Oracle June 2012  –  September 2014  (2 years 4 months) Utrecht Area, Netherlands In this position Mark was responsible and accountable for the sales and delivery of Application Consulting Services aimed at IT Architecture, Project Management and Consulting Services to various customers in the Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg. Managing Director Accenture 2008  –  2012  (4 years) In this position Mark was responsible and accountable for the sales and delivery of Application Outsourcing Services aimed at onshore and offshore application maintenance, testing and development (SAP & Oracle) to various customers.  
In addition Mark was responsible and accountable for the Accenture Delivery Centre in the Netherlands delivering application skills, assets and services. Director Application Outsourcing Logica June 2007  –  February 2008  (9 months) As delivery director Mark was responsible for the delivery of on/near & offshore application services (steady state service and new business development) in the Netherlands. Application services exists of: development, testing, maintenance, packaged service (SAP, Oracle, Microsoft) and product engineering. Delivery Project Executive IBM January 2002  –  May 2007  (5 years 5 months) As Delivery Project Executive Mark was responsible for the delivery of service (infrastructure and application services) to strategic outsourcing customers like Essent, Mitsubishi Motors Europe, KLM, Volker Wessels and Norfolkline. Project Manager EMEA service Logistics IBM April 2000  –  December 2002  (2 years 9 months) As project manager Mark was responsible for design & implementation of the IBM ESL reverse logistical process and the allocation and charging methodology for IBM ESL. Project Manager CMG February 1998  –  March 2000  (2 years 2 months) As project manager I was responsible for the harmonisation of production planning processes and the implementation of standard planning software application for Unilever Food and Beverages Europe. 
As project manager I was responsible for the implementation of the module Material Management of SAP R/3 at TNO Wegtransport. Software Engineer Business Applications Ericsson August 1996  –  January 1998  (1 year 6 months) Lead programmer SAP ABAP. Product Management - Software Industry - US and Asia Software Industry 1995  –  2002  (7 years) USA After returning from Tokyo, I was hired as the Asia Pacific Technical Support Manager at FTP Software in Andover, MA. Created a support channel in Asia for FTP, including a development group in South Korea. Promoted to product manager of the "Cyber Agent" technology - one of the first Java-based applications that communicated from the client to software roaming the Internet. Cyber Agents are akin to today's Internet "cookies".  
 
When FTP Software closed its doors along with many dotcom companies, Segue Software hired me as a product manager for Java-based technology that conducts QA (quality assurance) testing automatically on software applications and websites. Managed product development from the marketing side - including the "Silk Bean" product that sits on a client machine to communicate with Segue's other Java-based testing software. 
 
By 1997, started my own consulting business offering services including SAS programming, training on "internationalization" and "localization" of software for Asian markets and introducing software companies to potential partners in Japan and other Asian countries. IT Director - ASI Market Research, Tokyo, Japan Nielsen 1992  –  1995  (3 years) Tokyo, Japan Designed and implemented an English-Japanese network for the Tokyo office following an analysis of the market research work process. Removed outdated IBM mainframe prior to installation. Automated the survey research process, which was still conducted via paper surveys. 
 
Traveled throughout Asia to work with sister companies on design plans for an inter-company wide area network.  
 
This was the first bilingual network and application in the market research industry in Japan. Windows had just been released in Japanese for the first time.  
 
ASI was purchased by Dun & Bradstreet while I was there - later sold to A.C. Nielsen. Today, the firm still collects data on consumer behavior throughout Asia. Promoted to product manager of the "Cyber Agent" technology - one of the first Java-based applications that communicated from the client to software roaming the Internet. Cyber Agents are akin to today's Internet "cookies".  
 
When FTP Software closed its doors along with many dotcom companies, Segue Software hired me as a product manager for Java-based technology that conducts QA (quality assurance) testing automatically on software applications and websites. Managed product development from the marketing side - including the "Silk Bean" product that sits on a client machine to communicate with Segue's other Java-based testing software. 
 
By 1997, started my own consulting business offering services including SAS programming, training on "internationalization" and "localization" of software for Asian markets and introducing software companies to potential partners in Japan and other Asian countries.
